pullRequest.body:
We add some more API for `LinearIndepOn`.


The large import is so a lemma about dimension can be stated with `Set.encard` - it is unclear where such a lemma belongs if not where it is. 

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/70c66d1b-fcf4-4e30-b70b-68947870fd71/to/9ed17317-b826-4d7f-90af-afd86cdb299d) against commit f03b5ad8a618237850fee071a6eede4281b52850.

|-|-:|:-:|

:v: apnelson1 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/14127957845/job/39581218971)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/14127957845/job/39581218670)

Thanks, and thanks also to @madvorak for help with review.

bors d+

Thanks, and thanks also to @madvorak for help with review.

bors d+
Do you need to redeclare `ι` here?
I would rather put it outside of the namespace than having to write `_root_` here.

I think it's fine as it is. I agree it is desirable to avoid `_root_` but the alternatives (additional sectioning or less `variable` reuse) seem at least as undesirable given that this is just one lemma.
Perhaps `<|` is not needed here?
Good point, we should drop the `<|`.

This is just a bunch of nitpicks but how about:
```suggestion
theorem toENat_rank_span_set {v : ι → M} {s : Set ι} (hs : LinearIndepOn R v s) :
    (Module.rank R <| span R (v '' s)).toENat = s.encard := by
```
I.e.:

- Martin's point about `ι` already existing
- Dropping `↑` (it's not officially in the style guide but I think we should only include these when necessary)
- Using `<|` to avoid `)))`
- When a line break is required, prioritise giving the content after the colon a line to itself

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: a bit more LinearIndepOn api
